text: Elverta is an unincorporated community northwest of Sacramento, California. It was named after Elverta Dike, whose husband donated property to a nearby church. It is in Sacramento County, California. The postal code of the city is 95626. In 2020 there were 5,435 people living in Elverta. Elverta is about from Sacramento, California, miles from Rio Linda, California, from Roseville, California, and from Antelope, California. == History == It was named after Elverta Dike, whose husband donated property to a nearby church. The community of Elverta/Rio Linda is on the part on the land grant of Rancho Del Paso of 1844. In 1910, a company named Fruit Land Company of Minneapolis got of the grant and in 1912 the area was splited with Elverta and Rio Linda. == Geography == Elverta is an unincoporated community and it is part of the Sacramento metropolitan area; the metropolitan area including Sacramento (State capital and County seat of California), also Arden-Arcade and Roseville. Elverta is at (38.723216, -121.45452) According to the United States Census Bureau, the unincorporated community has a total area of 8.8 square miles (22.9 square kilometers). == Notes == == Other websites == *Official website of Elverta - Rio Linda on Sacramento County Website *Elverta Joint Elementary School District *First Baptist Church of Elverta *Zip Code 95626 Detailed Profile *Elverta, California Information Epodunk.com *Elverta, CA Zip Code 95626 Category:Unincorporated communities in California Category:Settlements in Sacramento County, California
title: Elverta, California
